00042 
00043 // The older bpmap files had a corruption in the way the floating point
00044 // values were written. This flag is used to toggle the way the values are
00045 // read. The older files should use ReadFloatFromOldBPMAP.
00046 static bool g_OlderBPMAPFileFormat=true;

00048 
00050 
00051 bool GDACSequenceHitItemType::operator<(const GDACSequenceHitItemType &rhs) const
00052 {
00053   // numeric sort on position, then strand, then PM X, then PM Y, then MM X, then MM Y
00054    if( this->Position == rhs.Position && this->TopStrand == rhs.TopStrand && this->PMX == rhs.PMX && this->PMY == rhs.PMY && this->MMX == rhs.MMX && this->MMY < rhs.MMY) return true;
00055 
00056    if( this->Position == rhs.Position && this->TopStrand == rhs.TopStrand && this->PMX == rhs.PMX && this->PMY == rhs.PMY && this->MMX < rhs.MMX) return true;
00057 
00058    if( this->Position == rhs.Position && this->TopStrand == rhs.TopStrand && this->PMX == rhs.PMX && this->PMY < rhs.PMY) return true;
00059 
00060    if( this->Position == rhs.Position && this->TopStrand == rhs.TopStrand && this->PMX < rhs.PMX) return true;
00061 
00062    if( this->Position == rhs.Position && this->TopStrand< rhs.TopStrand) return true;
00063 
00064    if( this->Position < rhs.Position ) return true;
00065 
00066    return false;
00067 }

00071 CBPMAPFileData::CBPMAPFileData() :

00095 
00096 void CBPMAPFileData::Close()
00097 {
00098         m_DataStartPosition = 0;
00099         m_NumberSequences = 0;
00100         m_SequenceItems.erase(m_SequenceItems.begin(), m_SequenceItems.end());
00101 
00102 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00103         if (m_bFileOpen)
00104         {
00105                 if (m_bFileMapped)
00106                 {
00107                         UnmapViewOfFile(m_lpFileMap);
00108                         m_lpFileMap = NULL;
00109                         CloseHandle(m_hFileMap);
00110                         m_hFileMap = NULL;
00111                         m_lpData = NULL;
00112                 }
00113                 CloseHandle(m_hFile);
00114                 m_hFile = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
00115                 m_bFileOpen = false;
00116         }
00117 #else
00118         if (m_fp == NULL)
00119         {
00120                 if (m_bFileMapped == true)
00121                 {
00122                         munmap(m_lpFileMap, m_MapLen);
00123                         m_MapLen = 0;
00124                 }
00125                 if (m_fp)
00126                         fclose(m_fp);
00127                 m_fp = NULL;
00128         }
00129 #endif
00130 }

00138         return (stat(m_FileName.c_str(), &st) == 0);

00143 bool CBPMAPFileData::ReadHeader()

00146         if (ReadFile(true) == false)
00147         {
00148                 Close();
00149                 return false;
00150         }

00168 
00169 #define DNA_BASE_A     0
00170 #define DNA_BASE_C     1
00171 #define DNA_BASE_G     2
00172 #define DNA_BASE_T     3
00173 #define DNA_BASE_OTHER 4
00174 
00175 static int int_to_acgt(unsigned int i, char *c) {
00176   switch(i) {
00177     case DNA_BASE_A:
00178       *c = 'A';
00179       break;
00180     case DNA_BASE_C:
00181       *c = 'C';
00182       break;
00183     case DNA_BASE_G:
00184       *c = 'G';
00185       break;
00186     case DNA_BASE_T:
00187       *c = 'T';
00188       break;
00189     default:
00190       *c = 'N';
00191       break;
00192   }
00193 
00194   if(*c == 'N')
00195     return(EXIT_FAILURE);
00196   else
00197     return(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00198 }
00199 
00201 
00202 static int byte_to_dna(const char *b, unsigned short n_b, char *d, unsigned short n_d)
00203 /*
00204 ** b is the array of bytes to be converted
00205 ** n_b is the length of the byte array
00206 ** d is the char array where the converted dna will be written
00207 ** n_d is the number of bases which should be extracted.
00208 */
00209 {
00210   unsigned short n_bytes,i,j,k;
00211 
00212   /* Do we have enough bytes for the requested dna? */
00213   if(n_d > 4*n_b) {
00214         //fprintf(stderr,"byte_to_dna: request for %d bases from %d bytes, not possible.\n",n_d,n_b);
00215         return(EXIT_FAILURE);
00216   }
00217 
00218   n_bytes = (unsigned short) ::ceil(n_d/(float)4); /* number of bytes we need to process */
00219   for(i=0,j=0; i<n_bytes; i++) {
00220         /* printf("byte_to_dna: n_bytes = %d, n_d=%d, about to translate b[%d] = %u\n",n_bytes,n_d,i,(unsigned char)b[i]); */
00221         for(k=0; k<4 && j<n_d; k++,j++) {
00222           if(int_to_acgt((b[i] >> (2*(3-k))) & 03,d+j)==EXIT_FAILURE)
00223                 return EXIT_FAILURE; //err_bcel("byte_to_dna: problem translating int: %d, b[%u]=%u\n",(b[i] >> (2*(3-j))) & 03,i,b[i]);
00224         }
00225   }
00226   d[j] = '\0';
00227 
00228   return(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00229 }

00232 
00233 bool CBPMAPFileData::ReadFile(bool bReadHeaderOnly)
00234 {
00235         // First Close the memory.
00236         Close();
00237 
00238         // Read the header
00239         if (ReadHeaderSection() == false)
00240         {
00241                 Close();
00242                 return false;
00243         }
00244 
00245         // Stop if just reading  
00246         if (bReadHeaderOnly)
00247         {
00248                 return true;
00249         }
00250 
00251         // Read the data.
00252         return ReadDataSection();
00253 }
00254 
00256 
00257 bool CBPMAPFileData::ReadHeaderSection()
00258 {
00259         // Open the file.
00260         std::ifstream instr;
00261         instr.open(m_FileName.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
00262 
00263         // Check if open
00264         if (!instr)
00265         {
00266                 m_strError = "Unable to open the file.";
00267                 return false;
00268         }
00269 
00270         // Read the magic number
00271         std::string magic;
00272         const int magic_size = BPMAP_FILE_HEADER_LEN;
00273         ReadFixedString(instr, magic, magic_size);
00274 
00275         // check the header is correct
00276         if(magic != BPMAP_FILE_HEADER_BYTES){
00277           m_strError = "File header is not of BPMAP type. ";
00278           return false;
00279         }
00280 
00281         // Get the version number
00282         m_Version = 0.0f;
00283         ReadFloatFromOldBPMAP_N(instr, m_Version);
00284         g_OlderBPMAPFileFormat = true;
00285 
00286         // Some of the BPMAP files had the version number written incorrectly.
00287         // If invalid version number from the first read attempt then try again.
00288         if (m_Version > 3.5f || m_Version < 0.5f)
00289         {
00290                 g_OlderBPMAPFileFormat = false;
00291                 instr.seekg(magic_size, std::ios_base::beg);
00292                 ReadFloat_N(instr, m_Version);
00293         }
00294 
00295 
00296         // Get the number of sequences
00297         uint32_t uval;
00298         ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00299         m_NumberSequences = uval;
00300 
00301 
00302         // Allocate memory for the sequence data
00303         m_SequenceItems.resize(m_NumberSequences);
00304 
00305         // Determine the position of the start of the data
00306         m_DataStartPosition = instr.tellg();
00307 
00308         // Close the file
00309         instr.close();
00310 
00311         return true;
00312 }
00313 
00315 
00316 bool CBPMAPFileData::ReadDataSection()
00317 {
00318         // Open the file.
00319         std::ifstream instr;
00320         instr.open(m_FileName.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
00321 
00322         // Check if open
00323         if (!instr)
00324         {
00325                 m_strError = "Unable to open the file.";
00326                 return false;
00327         }
00328 
00329 
00330         // Skip to the data section
00331         instr.seekg(m_DataStartPosition);
00332 
00333         // Read the sequence data.
00334         int iSeq;
00335         uint32_t uval;
00336         for (iSeq=0; iSeq<m_NumberSequences; iSeq++)
00337         {
00338                 ReadUIntLenString_N(instr, m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Name);
00339 
00340                 if (m_Version >= 3.0f)
00341                 {
00342                         ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00343                         m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_ProbePairs = uval;
00344                         ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00345                         m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_HitStartPosition = uval;
00346                 }
00347 
00348                 ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00349                 m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_NumberHits = uval;
00350 
00351                 if ((int) (m_Version+0.1) >= 2)
00352                 {
00353                         ReadUIntLenString_N(instr, m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_GroupName);
00354                         ReadUIntLenString_N(instr, m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_SeqVersion);
00355 
00356                         ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00357                         m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Parameters.resize(uval);
00358                         for (int iParam=0; iParam<(int)uval; iParam++)
00359                         {
00360                                 ReadUIntLenString_N(instr, m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Parameters[iParam].Tag);
00361                                 ReadUIntLenString_N(instr, m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Parameters[iParam].Value);
00362                         }
00363                 }
00364         }
00365 
00366 
00367         // Read more sequence data
00368         const int probeBufSize=64;
00369         unsigned char probeIn[PROBE_STORAGE_BUFFER_LENGTH]="";
00370         char probeOut[probeBufSize]="";
00371         for (iSeq=0; iSeq<m_NumberSequences; iSeq++)
00372         {
00373                 // Read the sequence values.
00374                 if(m_Version > 3.0f){
00375                   instr.seekg(m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_HitStartPosition);
00376                   ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00377                   m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Number = uval;
00378                 }
00379                 else {
00380                   ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00381                   m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Number = uval;
00382                   m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_HitStartPosition = instr.tellg();
00383                 }
00384 
00385 #ifndef _USE_MEM_MAPPING_
00386 
00387                 m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits.resize(m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_NumberHits);
00388                 m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_pHits = &m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits;
00389 
00390                 // Read the hit data (probe pair data).
00391                 for (int iHit=0; iHit<m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_NumberHits; iHit++)
00392                 {
00393                         ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00394                         m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].PMX = uval;
00395                         ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00396                         m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].PMY = uval;
00397                         if (m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_ProbePairs == PM_MM)
00398                         {
00399                                 ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00400                                 m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].MMX=uval;
00401                                 ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00402                                 m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].MMY=uval;
00403                         }
00404                         ReadUInt8(instr, m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].ProbeLength);
00405                         ReadFixedUCString(instr, probeIn, PROBE_STORAGE_BUFFER_LENGTH);
00406                         byte_to_dna((char *)probeIn, PROBE_STORAGE_BUFFER_LENGTH, probeOut, m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].ProbeLength);
00407                         m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].PMProbe = probeOut;
00408                         if (g_OlderBPMAPFileFormat == true)
00409                                 ReadFloatFromOldBPMAP_N(instr, m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].MatchScore);
00410                         else
00411                                 ReadFloat_N(instr, m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].MatchScore);
00412                         ReadUInt32_N(instr, uval);
00413                         m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].Position = uval;
00414                         uint8_t uval8;
00415                         ReadUInt8(instr, uval8);
00416                         m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_Hits[iHit].TopStrand=uval8;
00417                 }
00418 
00419 #else
00420 
00421                 // Determine the size of each hit.
00422                 int hitSize=(m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_ProbePairs == PM_MM ? HIT_ITEM_SIZE_WITH_PROBE_PAIRS : HIT_ITEM_SIZE_WITH_PM_ONLY);
00423 
00424                 m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_pHits = NULL;
00425                 int offset = m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_NumberHits * hitSize;
00426                 instr.seekg(offset, std::ios_base::cur);
00427 
00428 #endif
00429         }
00430 
00431 
00432         // Close the file
00433         instr.close();
00434 
00435 
00436 #ifdef _USE_MEM_MAPPING_
00437         
00438         // Initialize the bool flags.
00439         m_bFileOpen = false;
00440         m_bFileMapped = false;
00441 
00442 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00443 
00444         // Create the file.
00445         m_hFile = CreateFile(m_FileName.c_str(), GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ,
00446                         NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, NULL);
00447         if (m_hFile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00448         {
00449                 m_strError = "Unable to open the file.";
00450                 return false;
00451         }
00452         m_bFileOpen = true;
00453 
00454 
00455         // Map the file.
00456         m_hFileMap = CreateFileMapping(m_hFile, NULL, PAGE_READONLY, 0, 0, NULL);
00457         if (m_hFileMap != NULL)
00458         {
00459                 m_lpFileMap = MapViewOfFile(m_hFileMap, FILE_MAP_READ, 0, 0, 0);
00460                 if (m_lpFileMap == NULL)
00461                 {
00462                         CloseHandle (m_hFileMap);
00463                         m_hFileMap = NULL;
00464                         CloseHandle (m_hFile);
00465                         m_hFile = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
00466                         m_strError = "Unable to map view for the memory map file.";
00467                         Close();
00468                         return false;
00469                 }
00470                 else
00471                 {
00472                         m_lpData = (char *)m_lpFileMap;
00473                         m_bFileMapped = true;
00474                 }
00475         }
00476         else
00477         {
00478                 m_strError = "Unable to create memory map file.";
00479                 CloseHandle (m_hFile);
00480                 m_hFile = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
00481                 Close();
00482                 return false;
00483         }
00484 
00485 #else
00486 
00487         // Open the file
00488         m_fp = fopen(m_FileName.c_str(), "r");
00489         if (m_fp == NULL)
00490         {
00491                 m_strError = "Failed to open the file for memory mapping.";
00492                 Close();
00493                 return false;
00494         }
00495         m_bFileOpen = true;
00496         
00497         // Get the file size
00498         struct stat st;
00499         m_MapLen = 0;
00500         if (stat(m_FileName.c_str(), &st) == 0)
00501         {
00502                 m_MapLen = st.st_size;
00503         }
00504 
00505         // Map the file.
00506         m_lpFileMap = mmap(NULL, m_MapLen, PROT_READ, MAP_SHARED, fileno(m_fp), 0);
00507     if (m_lpFileMap == MAP_FAILED)
00508         {
00509                 m_strError = "Unable to map view for the memory map file.";
00510                 Close();
00511                 return false;
00512         }
00513         else
00514         {
00515                 m_lpData = (char *)m_lpFileMap;
00516                 m_bFileMapped = true;
00517         }
00518 
00519 #endif
00520 
00521         // Set the data pointer for each sequence item.
00522         for (iSeq=0; iSeq<m_NumberSequences; iSeq++)
00523         {
00524                 m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_bMapped = true;
00525                 m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_lpData = m_lpData + m_SequenceItems[iSeq].m_HitStartPosition;
00526         }
00527 
00528 #endif
00529 
00530         return true;
00531 }

00535 void CBPMAPFileData::GetSequenceItem(int index, CGDACSequenceItem &seq)
00536 {
00537         seq.MakeShallowCopy(m_SequenceItems[index]);

00561 
00562 void CGDACSequenceItem::MakeShallowCopy(CGDACSequenceItem &orig)
00563 {
00564         m_Name = orig.m_Name;
00565         m_GroupName = orig.m_GroupName;
00566         m_SeqVersion = orig.m_SeqVersion;
00567         m_Number = orig.m_Number;
00568         m_NumberHits = orig.m_NumberHits;
00569         m_pHits = &orig.m_Hits;
00570         m_Parameters = orig.m_Parameters;
00571         m_bMapped = orig.m_bMapped;
00572         m_lpData = orig.m_lpData;
00573         m_HitStartPosition = orig.m_HitStartPosition;
00574         m_ProbePairs = orig.m_ProbePairs;
00575 }
00576 
00578 
00579 void CGDACSequenceItem::GetHitItem(int index, GDACSequenceHitItemType &hit, bool readProbe)
00580 {
00581         if (m_bMapped == false)
00582         {
00583           hit = (*m_pHits)[index];
00584         }
00585         else
00586         {
00587                 // Determine the size of each hit
00588                 int hitSize=(m_ProbePairs == PM_MM ? HIT_ITEM_SIZE_WITH_PROBE_PAIRS : HIT_ITEM_SIZE_WITH_PM_ONLY);
00589 
00590                 // Get the offset and then the data.
00591                 char *lpData = m_lpData + (index*hitSize);
00592 
00593                 int offset = 0;
00594                 hit.PMX = MmGetUInt32_N((uint32_t *)(lpData + offset));
00595                 offset += INT_SIZE;
00596 
00597                 hit.PMY = MmGetUInt32_N((uint32_t *)(lpData + offset));
00598                 offset += INT_SIZE;
00599 
00600                 if (m_ProbePairs == PM_MM)
00601                 {
00602                         hit.MMX = MmGetUInt32_N((uint32_t *)(lpData + offset));
00603                         offset += INT_SIZE;
00604 
00605                         hit.MMY = MmGetUInt32_N((uint32_t *)(lpData + offset));
00606                         offset += INT_SIZE;
00607                 }
00608 
00609                 hit.ProbeLength = *(unsigned char *)(lpData+offset);
00610                 offset += UCHAR_SIZE;
00611 
00612                 if (readProbe == true)
00613                 {
00614                         const int probeBufSize=64;
00615                         char probeOut[probeBufSize];
00616                         const char *probeIn = lpData + offset;
00617                         byte_to_dna(probeIn, PROBE_STORAGE_BUFFER_LENGTH, probeOut, hit.ProbeLength);
00618                         hit.PMProbe = probeOut;
00619                 }
00620                 offset += PROBE_STORAGE_BUFFER_LENGTH;
00621 
00622                 if (g_OlderBPMAPFileFormat == true)
00623                         hit.MatchScore = MmGetFloatFromOldBPMAP_N((float *)(lpData + offset));
00624                 else
00625                         hit.MatchScore = MmGetFloat_N((float *)(lpData + offset));
00626                 offset += FLOAT_SIZE;
00627 
00628                 hit.Position = MmGetUInt32_N((uint32_t *)(lpData + offset));
00629                 offset += INT_SIZE;
00630 
00631                 hit.TopStrand = *(unsigned char *)(lpData+offset);
00632         }
00633 }

00642 
00643 std::string CGDACSequenceItem::FullName() const
00644 {
00645         if (m_SeqVersion.length() > 0)
00646         {
00647                 return (m_GroupName + ":" + m_SeqVersion + ";" + m_Name);
00648         }
00649         else
00650                 return m_Name;
00651 }
